meanings.definition: Weathered rock material in which the rock structure is still recognizable.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists found ancient saprolites while excavating the site.
meanings.sent2: The saprolites on the mountain showed signs of erosion over time.
meanings.sent3: The saprolites seemed to be playing hide and seek with the geologists.
meanings.sent4: The saprolites stood like ancient guardians, silently watching over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the saprolites revealed a history written in stone.

meanings.definition: A layer of decomposed rock material that forms in situ.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers encountered a thick layer of saprolites while digging the foundation.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the saprolites at the bottom of the valley turned into fertile soil.
meanings.sent3: The saprolites seemed to be having a party underground, decomposing and mingling with other rocks.
meanings.sent4: The saprolites acted as a natural blanket, protecting the underlying rocks from the elements.
meanings.sent5: The farmer knew that the saprolites were a sign of potential agricultural productivity.
